isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - POWER STEERING GEAR: SHEPPARD MODEL 292, 392, 492 - DISASSEMBLE - SERIES 5 HOUSING REPAIR

svcproc.title: SERIES 5 HOUSING REPAIR
svcproc.para: If the needle bearing in the housing is to be replaced, the output shaft seal and snap ring (if used) must be removed to gain access to the bearing. Remove the bearing from the housing by pressing it out ( Figure 53).
On reassembly, press the bearing into the housing until it is flush with the inside surface of the housing.

note.para: Some Series 5 housings have a snap ring on the bearing. In this case the bearing is pressed into the housing until the snap ring contacts the housing ( Figure 54).

svcproc.para: The needle bearing in the pinion cover is removed using a bushing removal tool similar to the one illustrated ( Figure 55).

figure.caption: Figure 55. Remove Needle Bearing in Pinion Cover

note.para: The bearing should not be removed unless it is going to be replaced.

svcproc.para: A new bearing is pressed into place flush with the face of the bearing bore and against the spacer in the bore of the pinion housing.

note.para: Some Series 5 steering gears use a double row needle bearing where the needle rollers are loose. During service, care must be taken to ensure that the needle rollers are installed in the bearing housing which they came out of. Use chassis lube to hold the needle rollers in the bearing races during reassembly.
